titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alan Sondheim Papers MSS.267
titlestmt.author: Rachel Mahre

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-11 08:15:28 -0500.

physdesc.extent: in 52 records cartons, 6 flat boxes, 1 small cassette box, and 1 large reel
15 8mm films, 4 super8 films, 21 16mm films, 4 35mm films, 1 offsite film

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Alan Sondheim in April, 2010; the accession number associated with this collection is 2009-267.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact [Fales, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596] with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Alan Sondheim Papers; MSS 267; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 221 optical discs, 1 hard drive, and 2 floppy disks were imaged during the survey process and ingested into Forensic ToolKit, where the digital files were arranged into Electronic Records.

Films stored in unsuitable containers, many exhiting signs of vinegar syndrome, were scanned and rehoused by Preservation during the collection survey process. Several audio reels were also rehoused. Images of the original containers have been uploaded to the Preservation Drive.

Several photographs received treatment from Preservation during the survey process, including photos that were stuck together, photos stuck in enclosures, and negative strips that needed special housing.

Audio reel 267_124 in Box 24 (Barcode 31142063407004) was identified as moldy on December 6, 2021. Theis item is currently isolated from other items in the box by housing it in a polyethylene bag with a desiccated board and RH monitor strip. If this strip indicates an RH greater than 50%, the Preservation department should be contacted ASAP. Do not open this packaging without contacting the Preservation Department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This LP features Alan Sondheim on acoustic-electric guitar, guzheng, oud, alpine zither, and ukulele; Azure Carter's voice; and Helena Espvall on cello. It was produced by Fire Museum Records in association with Tequila Sunrise Records.

scopecontent.p: According to the tape labels, each tape shows a recording from a different camera. 267_567 and 267_341 are the video and audio from Fran's camera. 267_574 is the "2nd camera, Fran and Rich Gold, silent, to be synced up with Marlis Schmidt's camera (Master)." 267_596 is Marlis Schmidt's camera - it's label also says "2nd tape with sound. Alan Sondheim, Denise de la Cerda, Devonna Walker, Randal Davis, Dallas. Master."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This tape contains poetry and musical performances by Paula Claire and the Paxton Group, which includes Steven Paxton, John Griffith, Ray Dillard, and Cynthia Cole. Performances include "Spiderunes," "The Dundee Telgrams, "The Patmost Poems," "Still Life," "Zen Inscriptions," "Through Glass," and "OIF."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The cassette's label says, "Side A: The Other Side (10:00); Side B: The Other Side (10:00); Azure Carter: Voice; Alan Sondheim: Hasapi; dominion of striations, vocalizations, spews, and vocalizations - and these can occur in any form, writing, tributes, determining vocalization, perfectly in the voice of azure, sub-vocalization or knot, perfectly in the voice of alan, sub-vocalization or knot. vocalizations becomes paramount, i'd add the prerequisites of walking and talking, subvocalizations dominion of striations, vocalizations. spews, and vocalizations - and these can occur in any form, writing, dominion of striations, vocalizations, electronics, vocalizations/song as body indices, breath/rattling/string and skysphere removal and new spheres, new vocalizations, new grit, new organs impacted by the exertions of the movement, the vocalizations were laced with spews, and vocalizations - and these can occur in any form, listen - "

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 267_579's label says, "Duplicate, without time base correction. With Alan Sondheim, Laura Hayes. Produced at Monte-Video Hartford Connecticut, John Hyjek Camera and Tech. Produced and directed by Alan Sondheim, August 1979. Screenings at Montevideo Franklin Furnace NYC< Real Art Ways, Hartford." It also has an address to Sondheim's office at UCLA. 267_572's label says, "For Grant Application. This videotape is similar to my current films; the latter are masterprints only, and can only be rarely projected. Shown at: Museum of Modern Art, New York City; American Center, Paris; Kitchen, New York City. Distributed by: Art Metropole, Toronto, Canada."

did.unittitle: Sections 1-8 of First Film Series - Supporting Materials for Guggenheim Application

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The tape's label says, "Alan Sondheim, sections 1-8 of first film series, 1981-1982, from 16mm optical sound black and white. This series consists of 40+ segments, made at the rate of one reel per week, edited in-camera. They deal with ideology, politicization, the position of the subject, and are made to be shown together."
